thread.title: Gordon Square Fall Fest launches inaugural fall festival with storefront performances
thread.title_full: Gordon Square Fall Fest launches inaugural fall festival with storefront performances | cleveland.com

author: Lisa DeJong, The Plain Dealer
title: Gordon Square Fall Fest launches inaugural fall festival with storefront performances
text:
CLEVELAND, OH -- Detroit Shoreway Community Development Organization in partnership with Cleveland Public Theatre and Cuyahoga Arts and Culture brought Cleveland's alternative arts district alive with their inaugural fall festival titled "Test Flight" with music and theater performances in storefronts and outdoor stages on Saturday. The free fest culminated in a late night party at Cleveland Public Theatre, starting at 9 p.m.
The free event in the Gordon Arts District also celebrates the opening of the 2015-2016 theatrical season. Featured performers were Robin Van Lear, Pinch & Squeal's WIZBANG! Theatre, Papo Ruiz y La Dulzura de la Salsa and the return of Caley Vickerman aka "Haiku Mistress" of Guerilla Haiku. Performances also included Cleveland Public Theatre and Near West Theatre. Running concurrently with Gordon Square Fall Fest, the Capitol Theatre will host 12 HOURS OF TERROR, an all-night horror move marathon that begins at 8 p.m. on Saturday and runs through 8 a.m on Sunday.
